channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Aalto University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Algebraic Positional Encodings
item.description: Revolutionizing Transformers, Algebraic Positional Encodings (APE) offers a theory-first approach to positional encoding, outperforming state-of-the-art methods without hyperparameter tuning across va…

item.title: Amortized Bayesian Experimental Design for Decision-Making
item.description: Amortized Decision-Aware BED prioritizes maximizing downstream decision utility by instantly proposing informative experimental designs and inferring decisions, facilitating accurate decision-making.

item.title: Applying Guidance in a Limited Interval Improves Sample and Distribution Quality in Diffusion Models
item.description: Boosting image generation: Applying guidance selectively during diffusion model sampling drastically enhances image quality and inference speed, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Generating Code World Models with Large Language Models Guided by Monte Carlo Tree Search
item.description: LLMs guided by Monte Carlo Tree Search generate precise, efficient Python code as world models for model-based reinforcement learning, significantly improving sample efficiency and inference speed.

item.title: Improving robustness to corruptions with multiplicative weight perturbations
item.description: Boost DNN robustness to corruptions without sacrificing clean image accuracy using Data Augmentation via Multiplicative Perturbations (DAMP)!

item.title: Learning Structure-Aware Representations of Dependent Types
item.description: This research pioneers the integration of machine learning with the dependently-typed programming language Agda, introducing a novel dataset and neural architecture for faithful program representation…

item.title: Preference Learning of Latent Decision Utilities with a Human-like Model of Preferential Choice
item.description: Human-like choice modeling revolutionizes preference learning! A new tractable model, CRCS, significantly improves utility inference from human data, outperforming existing methods.
